title: Word Search
description: Given an m x n grid of characters board and a string word, return true if word exists in the grid. The word can be constructed from letters of sequentially adjacent cells, where adjacent cells are horizontally or vertically neighboring. The same letter cell may not be used more than once.
constraints: board and word consists of only lowercase and uppercase English letters.

steps.instruction: Define the function exist that takes board and word.

steps.placeholderCode:
ROWS, COLS = len(board), len(board[0])
    path = set()
    def dfs(r, c, i):
        if i == len(word):
            return True
        if (r < 0 or c < 0 or r >= ROWS or c >= COLS or
            word[i] != board[r][c] or (r, c) in path):
            return False
        path.add((r, c))
        res = (dfs(r + 1, c, i + 1) or
               dfs(r - 1, c, i + 1) or
               dfs(r, c + 1, i + 1) or
               dfs(r, c - 1, i + 1))
        path.remove((r, c))
        return res
steps.hint:
Implement DFS to check adjacent cells. Use a set to track visited cells in the current path.

Example:
Word="AB". Board=[['A', 'B']].
Start at (0,0) 'A'. Match! Path={(0,0)}.
Check neighbors. (0,1) is 'B'. Match!
Word found.

steps.hint: Start DFS from every cell in the grid.
